comments: (a(n)+1)^3 - a(n)^3 is a square (that of A001570(n)).Define a(1)=0 a(2)=7 such that 3*(a(1)^2)+3*a(1)+1=j(1)^2=1^2 and 3*(a(2)^2)+3*a(2)+1=j(2)^2=13^2. Then a(n)=a(n-2)+8*sqrt(3*(a(n-1)^2)+3*a(n-1)+1). Another definition : a(n) such that 3*(a(n)^2)+3*a(n)+1 = j(n)^2. - _Pierre CAMI_, Mar 30 2005a(n) = A001353(n)*A001075(n+1). For n>0, the triple {a(n), a(n)+1=A001922(n), A001570(n)} forms a near-isosceles triangle with angle 2*Pi/3 bounded by the consecutive sides. - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Jul 21 2006
